favourite.article: Lord, abide in me.
Lord, we want to abide in You!
This hymn is so marvelous! I love the tune! May the Lord dispense grace into us continually by just enjoying Him!
Dear brother Jon...golden. Thank you. Yes, dear saints, praise the Triune God. He is so sweet...Amen.

This dear hymn embodies the depths of the heart of the processed and consummated Triune God to bring His believers into Him and He in them to the end that they and He, He and they would have a focused corporate living of bringing others into the very God that they love, enjoy, and live in. Hallelujah for our God!!
Praise the Lord, saints! You can listen to this precious hymn here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xWBOXoTHMKw
I love this song.
Sister I have this song on my PC. If you like I can send it to you via email.
Yes, please if anyone could direct us to somewhere on the internet where this song is being sung, I too would greatly appreciate it.

The words to this song drip the Lord's precious grace. If anyone has a webpage that I can go to to listen to someone sing this, I would greatly appreciate it. I'm not musically inclined, so trying to listen to the music and place where the words go.... well, it's a challenge. Thank you, and may the love of Jesus richly abound in you!
Looking for a song that I would sing about "real growth" during a nation Pastors conference, I was so blessed when when I came across this song. This song is an answer to prayer. Praise God!

Amen, how we need to abide in the Lord continually and we should not be independent to Him. O Lord Jesus, I should take You as my Head. Apart from You Lord I can do nothing. Thank You that I'm part of this vine.

Right. You did not choose Me, but I chose you and I set you. That you should go forth and bear fruit, And that your fruit should remain,
Thank You Lord. That was me. But God you saved me, this must be my new life. Otherwise I will continue to be lost.

Amen Lord without You I can do nothing! Regardless of capacity, capability everything in the Lord is vain. The only worth to God should come from Christ. Lord Jesus, Lord Jesus, continue to make home in my hearts, occupy my whole being so that it is Christ and only Christ will operate through me.
Oh Lord, how much I need to abide in You.

We have a Glorious Father. Someone who cares, watches and loves us. I cannot say more than Thank Him, and Abide in HIM.
All I need to do is live in my Spirit.
Oh Lord Jesus!
I like this song because it makes me realize that apart from Christ I can do nothing. I'm so blessed that the Lord chose me, I just only need to abide in Him.
Oh Lord Jesus...I love You so much....You are the vine we are the branches...thank You Lord Jesus...
Apart from Him we can do nothing. How we need to abide in Him all the time.

I love this song. It touches me and reminded me all the time I fall apart. We cannot stand alone as a branch for the Vine is our everything. I am so blessed that He chooses me to be part of Him. I love You so much Lord Jesus Christ.

This is the universal spreading of Christ as the True Vine! He is the branch and we are the branches.When we abide in Christ as the universal Vine, we have the church life, a life of loving one another. If we have such an abiding, we will have an effective prayers for fruit-bearing! When we abide in the Lord and let His words abide in us, we actually are one with Him and He works within us, and there will be a desire in us that comes out of His words, and His desire will become our desire. Amen. Hallelujah!

Praise the Lord, we have been grafted into Christ as the vine! What a mercy that we who were once the wild olive tree have been grafted into the cultivated tree (Christ). We should always abide in Christ (the vine),for apart from Him we can do nothing. Lord, keep us each day abiding in You.
